title: Android Engineer, Financial Connections
content:
Location: New York, NY, USA Only
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Stripe’s Financial Connections group is building technology that expands the scope of problems we tackle beyond card payments. We build alternative payments, enable new product experiences on Stripe, and there’s more on the way. We have ambitious goals to enable global businesses to run their entire financial life cycle on Stripe, and we want you to be part of our story. 
Learn more about Financial Connections:

Our product page: Financial Connections
Stripe, Uber, & Financial Connections: Uber partners with Stripe to enhance payments performance and reduce costs
Stripe, Airbnb, & Financial Connections: Airbnb partners with Stripe to power bank payments

What you’ll do
Responsibilities

Join a cross functional team focused on supporting both merchants and consumers enabling financial data access and bank payments.
Design and build new features for the Connections’ Android SDKs, leveraging Stripe’s technology to enable new product experiences
Design, build, and maintain shared components for Stripe in Kotlin
Work with product managers, user researchers, designers, data scientists and other engineers to empathize with external users and build solutions to address their needs
Optimize consumer flows to create a seamless user experience that delights both businesses and consumers

Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

Have a strong technical background, with 1.5+ years of industry experience in Android development using Kotlin
Have a desire and ability to empathize with the many different types of users who depend on Stripe’s products and APIs
Have a passion for building delightful user experiences
Prefer simple solutions and designs over complex ones, and have a good intuition for what is lasting and scalable
You measure your success in terms of business impact, not lines of code

Preferred qualifications

2+ years of experience in Android development using Kotlin
Some experience with Jetpack Compose and dependency injection with Dagger.
Enjoy working with a diverse group of people with different areas of expertise. Engineering works closely with a variety of teams: Sales and Support to better understand our customers’ needs, Legal and Accounting to understand how global policies influence our money-moving infrastructure, etc

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
